trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the homunculus is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails. It can't use this trait if it's {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Force Strike
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30 ft., one target you can see. {@h}{@damage 1d4 + 3} force damage.

reaction.name: Channel Magic
entries: The homunculus delivers a spell you cast that has a range of touch. The homunculus must be within 120 feet of you.

trait.name: Vigilant
entries: The defender can't be surprised.

action.name: Force-Empowered Rend
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target you can see. {@h}{@damage 1d8 + 3} force damage. If the target is Medium or smaller it becomes {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and the defender can use its action to deal {@damage 1d8 + 3} force damage. The defender can grapple only one target at a time.

action.name: Repair (3/Day)
entries: The magical mechanisms inside the defender restore {@dice 2d8 + 3} hit points to itself or to one construct or object within 5 feet of it.

reaction.name: Deflect Attack
entries: The defender imposes disadvantage on the attack roll of one creature it can see that is within 5 feet of it, provided the attack roll is against a creature other than the defender.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the goat moves at least 15 feet straight toward a target it starts charging.

trait.name: Sure-Footed
entries: The goat has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Mounted
entries: During a long rest, the goat can designate one creature that rode it within the last 10 days as its rider. The goat gains temporary hit points equal to 4 times the rider’s level or challenge rating after completing the long rest. The goat uses its rider’s proficiency bonus in place of its own proficiency bonus for AC, ability checks, attack rolls, saving throws, and the DC made to save against certain action effects.

trait.name: Mountain Breed
entries: The goat ignores difficult terrain and its long and high jump are 30 feet.

action.name: Combat Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, or 13 ({@damage 4d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage if the goat is charging on the same turn. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: High Ground
entries: The goat needs to stand at least 10 feet higher than the target to use this action. The goat sprints down from its higher position, using gravity to gain speed. The target gets knocked {@condition prone} immediately and has to make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save and half as much on a successful one.

action.name: Dogfight (3/Day)
entries: The goat attacks with combat ram uses it horns to lock a target into single combat. Until the target succeeds a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw, it can only attack the goat or its rider. The target can make the saving throw at the end of its turns.

trait.name: Mounted
entries: During a long rest, the lizard can designate one creature that rode it within the last 10 days as its rider. The lizard gains temporary hit points equal to 4 times the rider’s level or challenge rating after completing the long rest. The lizard uses its rider’s proficiency bonus in place of its own proficiency bonus for AC, ability checks, attack rolls, saving throws, and the DC made to save against certain action effects.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The lizard can hold its breath for 15 minutes. (A lizard that has this trait also has a swimming speed of 30 feet.)

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Clapping (1/Day)
entries: The lizards rider gains one Lizard Inspiration die, a {@dice d6}. Once within the next 10 minutes, the creature can roll the die and add the number rolled to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw it makes.

reaction.name: Book it! (1/Day)
entries: If it or its rider is hit, the lizard can move up to its speed away from the attacker. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

A giant lizard can be ridden or used as a draft animal. Lizardfolk also keep them as pets, and subterranean giant lizards are used as mounts and pack animals by drow, duergar, and other Underdark dwellers.
Variant: Giant Lizard Traits
Some giant lizards have one or both of the following traits. Hold Breath. The lizard can hold its breath for 15 minutes. (A lizard that has this trait also has a swimming speed of 30 feet.)

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries: The lizard can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saves against poison and resistance against poison damage.

trait.name: Stonecunning
entries: Whenever you make an Intelligence (History) check related to the origin of stonework, you are considered proficient in the History skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check.

trait.name: Boomerang of Warning
entries: While the boomerang of warning is on Ermnik's person, he has advantage on initiative rolls. In addition, he and any of his companions within 30 feet of him can't be surprised, except when {@condition incapacitated} by something other than nonmagical sleep. The boomerang magically awakens him and his companions within range if any of them are sleeping naturally when combat begins.

trait.name: Reckless Attack
entries: When you make your first attack on your turn, you can decide to attack recklessly, giving you advantage on melee weapon attack rolls using STR during this turn, but attack rolls against you have advantage until your next turn.

action.name: Extra Attack
entries: Ermnik can attack twice, instead of once, whenever he takes the Attack action on his turn.

action.name: Axe of Slaying
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Boomerang of Warning
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) damage.

bonus.name: Rage (3/Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action enter a rage for up to 1 minute (10 rounds).

You gain advantage on STR checks and saving throws (not attacks), +2 melee damage with STR weapons, resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, slashing damage. You can't cast or concentrate on spells while raging.

Your rage ends early if you are knocked {@condition unconscious} or if your turn ends and you haven’t attacked a hostile creature since your last turn or taken damage since then. You can also end your rage as a bonus action.

bonus.name: Frenzy Attack
entries: While in a frenzy, you can make a single melee weapon attack as a bonus action on each of your turns after this one.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The drow acolyte has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the drow acolyte to sleep.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the drow acolyte has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Signature Attack
entries: {@i Rapier}
{@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.
At 7th level, retainers can take two signature attacks per round.

action.name: Bless (3/Day)
entries: {@spell Bless} at 2nd level. {@i Prerequisite: 5th-level retainer, Triss}

action.name: Bane (3/Day)
entries: {@spell Bane} at 2nd level. {@i Prerequisite: 5th-level retainer, Nili}

bonus.name: Bladesong (3/Day)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 3rd-level retainer}
The drow acolyte can use a bonus action to start the Bladesong, which lasts for 1 minute. While its bladesong is active, it gains the following benefits:
- You have advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks.
- You gain a +3 (Wisdom) bonus to any Constitution saving throws you make to maintain concentration on a spell.

bonus.name: Spiritual Weapon (1/Day)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 7th-level retainer}
{@spell Spiritual Weapon} at 4th level (Rapier).
{@atk ms} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) force damage.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Signature Attack
entries: {@i {@spell Ray of Frost}}
{@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, range 60/60 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage, and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of the sage's next turn.

action.name: Blink (3/Day)
entries: {@spell Blink}. {@i Prerequisite: 5th-level retainer}

action.name: Dimension Door (1/Day)
entries: {@spell Dimension Door}. {@i Prerequisite: 7th-level retainer}

action.name: The Library (1/Day)
entries: {@i Artisan: The Sage}
The sage makes a {@dc 15} Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check. On a success choose one of the following advantages:
• You have advantage on your next attack roll against the target.
• You negate one resistance on your next attack
roll against the target.
• The target has disadvantage on its next saving throw against your spells or abilities.
You meaning one allied creature.

bonus.name: Misty Step (3/Day)
entries: {@spell Misty Step}. {@i Prerequisite: 3rd-level retainer}

Tens of thousands of years ago, the elves were divided, with those of benevolent disposition battling those that were selfish and cruel. The war among elvenkind ended when the good elves banished their malevolent kin to the subterranean depths. Here, in the lightless caverns and endless warrens of twisting passages, the dark elves-the drow-found refuge. They also found leadership in the only elven deity who had not forsaken them. At her command, the dark elves built an empire in the underworld.

entries.name: Children of Lolth
entries: The drow worship Lolth, a deity who resides in the Abyss. Known as the Spider Queen or the Demon Queen of Spiders, she is the figure around which the dark elves have built their subterranean civilization. Whatever she demands, the drow do. The wickedest of elves, drow are seldom seen by the surface world. Though they plot to destroy the elves that banished them, they no longer see themselves as exiles. They are the destined rulers of the darkness, and when Lolth commands them to rise up and destroy their surface-dwelling kin, they will.

entries.name: Creatures of Darkness
entries: The drow have lived underground for so long that they have evolved to their surroundings and can see in the dark. However, they can no longer stand sunlight. When slaves are in short supply in the Underdark, the drow send raiding parties to the surface to capture humanoids under cover of darkness, bringing them back to their cities to be tortured into submission. Beyond those occasional excursions, the drow are content to remain in their subterranean realm, where they feel secure and in control.

entries.name: Underdark Cities
entries: The dark elves build fantastic cities in enormous caverns where food and water are abundant. Their ability to sculpt stone rivals that of the greatest dwarf artisans, yet their structures retain a decidedly elven aesthetic. Though appearing delicate, drow settlements are structurally sound and remarkably resilient. The drow like to hollow out enormous stalagmites and stalactites, creating populated spires that rise from the floors and ceilings. A drow city is a sprawling metropolis enclosed by high walls. Non-drow visitors must conduct their business outside the walls under watchful eyes. The drow raise and keep giant spiders to help protect their cities against intruders, even as they drape those cities in beautiful webbing, creating a gossamer snare to catch flying enemies that would otherwise soar over the walls.

entries.name: Drow Magic
entries: Just as the drow have adapted to underground life, so too has their magic. In addition to using that magic to carve their cities from stone, they empower their weapons, create dangerous new magic items, and summon demons from the Abyss. Drow spellcasters are supremely arrogant and never hesitate to use their magic in the most abhorrent ways.

entries.name: Arms and Armor
entries: Drow craft weapons made of adamantine, a dark and supernaturally hard metal. Drow artisans adorn their weapons and armor with web-like filigree and spider motifs, and mages sometimes imbue items with magic to enhance their effectiveness. However, such magic fades when exposed to sunlight, so that magical drow weapons and armor rarely retain their enhancement bonuses and magical properties when brought to the surface.

entries.name: Cutthroat Politics
entries: Drow politics are cutthroat and rife with intrigue. When drow work together, it is typically to destroy a common foe and ensure their own survival, and such alliances are short lived and fraught with peril.

Drow society is divided into noble houses, each ruled by a matron who seeks to raise the prestige and power of her house above all others. Other high-ranking members of the house are blood relatives, while the middling ranks are flush with drow from weaker families that have sworn fealty to the greater house. Clinging precariously to the bottom rung of a house's social ladder are the house slaves, made up of drow of low birth and the occasional non-drow captive.

entries.name: Matriarchal Rule
entries: Lolth, through her faithful priestesses, dictates the rules of drow society, ensuring that her orders and plots are carried out. Since Lolth is prone to manifesting on the Material Plane and directly punishing those that disobey her, the drow have learned to heed what she says and do as her priestesses command.

In drow society, males are subservient to females. A male drow might lead an Underdark patrol or a raiding party to the surface, but he reports to a female drow-either the matron of his house or one of her hand-picked female subordinates. Although male drow can fill almost any function in drow society, they can't be priests, nor can they rule a house.

entries.name: Poison Predilection
entries: Distilled from spider venom and the flora of the Underdark, poison can be found in abundance among the drow, and it plays an important part in their culture and politics. Drow mages concoct a viscid toxin that leaves enemies {@condition unconscious}. Drow warriors coat their blades and crossbow bolts with this venom, looking forward to the interrogation and torture that follows combat.

entries.name: Variant: Drow Magic Armor and Weapons
entries: Drow often wear magic armor and carry magic weapons that lose their enhancement bonuses permanently if they are exposed to sunlight for 1 hour or longer.

items: A drow wearing a +1 chain shirt and carrying a +1 shortsword has AC 16 and a +1 bonus on attack and damage rolls with shortsword attacks.
A drow elite warrior wearing +2 studded leather and carrying a +2 shortsword has AC 20 and a +2 bonus on attack and damage rolls with shortsword attacks.
A drow priestess of Lolth wearing +3 scale mail has AC 19.

trait.name: Retainer
entries: This creature is a Retainer, as described in {@book Strongholds and Followers|SaF|8|Retainers}

action.name: Signature Attack
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) slashing damage.
At 7th level, retainers can take two signature attacks per round.

action.name: Gaping Wound (3/Day)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 3rd-level retainer}

The swordmaster makes an attack with their signature attack against an adjacent creature. On a hit, the target starts bleeding, taking 3 ({@dice 1d6}) damage at the start of each of its following turns. At the end of each of its turns, it can make a Constitution save to stop the bleeding.

action.name: Challenge (3/Day, Bonus Action)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 5th-level retainer}

The swordmaster issues a challenge to an adjacent creature. For 1 minute, if that creature attempts to attack a target other than the swordmaster, or attempts to move away from the swordmaster, the swordmaster immediately makes two attacks with their signature attack against that creature, ending the Challenge.

reaction.name: Retaliate (3/Day)
entries: {@i Prerequisite: 7th-level retainer}
After being hit by a melee attack, the swordmaster can immediately make three attacks against the attacker with their signature attack.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Thoradin is a 5th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). Thoradin has the following cleric spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: Fey Touched
headerEntries: Thoradin can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once he cast either of these spells in this way, he can't cast that spell in this way again until he finish a long rest. He can also cast these spells using spell slots he has of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

trait.name: Crusader (Domain Title)
entries: Thoradin has advantage on Wisdom saving throws and death saving throws, and he regain the maximum number of hit points from any effect that restores hit points.

trait.name: Disciple of Life
entries: Whenever Thoradin use a spell of 1st level or higher to restore hit points, the creature regains additional hit points equal to 2 + the spell’s level.

trait.name: Powerful Build
entries: Thoradin counts as one size larger when determining his carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

action.name: Mace of Sharindlar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Light Hammer
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage in melee, or 5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage at range.

action.name: Sacred Flame (Cantrip)
entries: Flame-like radiance descends on a creature that Thoradin can see within 60 feet. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d8} radiant damage. The target gains no benefit from cover for this saving throw.

action.name: Inflict Wounds (1st-Level Spell; Costs a Spell Slot)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d10 + 3}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Channel Divinity (2/Long Rest)
entries: Thoradin channels divine energy directly from his deity, using that energy to fuel one of the following magical effects: {@classFeature Turn Undead | Cleric || 2} (incl. {@classFeature Destroy Undead (CR 1/2) | Cleric || 5 || Destroy Undead}) or {@subclassFeature Channel Divinity: Preserve Life | Cleric || Life || 2 || Preserve Life}.

bonus.name: Spiritual Weapon (2nd-Level Spell; Costs a Spell Slot)
entries: Thoradin creates a floating, spectral weapon within 60 ft. that lasts for 1 minute. When he cast the spell, he can make a melee spell attack. On his subsequent turns, he can move the weapon up to 20 feet and repeat the attack.
{@atk ms} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) radiant damage.

bonus.name: Misty Step (1/Long Rest)
entries: Briefly surrounded by silvery mist, Thoradin teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that he can see.

reaction.name: Stone’s Endurance (1/Short Rest)
entries: Thoradin reduces damage dealt to him by {@dice 1d12 + 3}.

item.name: Shadow-Touched Spear
entries: While holding this magical spear you gain {@sense darkvision} out to the range of 30 feet.

When you attune to this magical spear, shadowy ink spreads across your body starting from your hands forming a tattoo. You gain the benefits from an {@item eldritch claw tattoo|tce} ({@bold Magical Strike}, {@bold Eldritch Maul}).
